snippet.title: Yancoal raising $A3.1b for C&A buy
snippet.content: Yancoal is seeking $US2.5 billion ($A3.1 billion) in equity funding from investors to buy Coal & Allied from mining giant Rio Rinto. Yancoal, which is controlled by Chinese coal giant Yanzhou, will raise the funds in two parts - a 23.6 for 1 pro-rata renounceable rights offer and share placement to strategic investors. The acquisition, which will total $US2.69 billion, will "redefine our position in the global coal marketplace", Yancoal chairman Xiyong Li said on Wednesday. Originally published as
